title: 1955–56 Hapoel Kfar Saba F.C. season
text:
The 1955–56 <a href="Hapoel%20Kfar%20Saba%20F.C.">Hapoel Kfar Saba</a> season was the club's 29th season since its establishment in 1928, and 8th since the establishment of the <a href="Israel">State of Israel</a>.
At the start of the season, the <a href="1954%E2%80%9355%20Liga%20Bet">league</a> which started during the <a href="1954%E2%80%9355%20in%20Israeli%20football">previous season</a> was completed, with the club finishing 12th (out of 14), which meant the club had to compete in a promotion/relegation play-offs against the 11th placed club, <a href="Beitar%20Jerusalem%20F.C.">Beitar Jerusalem</a>, and the two <a href="1954%E2%80%9355%20Liga%20Bet">Liga Bet</a> winners, <a href="Maccabi%20Jaffa%20F.C.">Maccabi Jaffa</a> and <a href="Hapoel%20Kiryat%20Haim%20F.C.">Hapoel Kiryat Haim</a>. Haopel Kfar Saba placed 2nd in the play-offs, preserving their top division status.
The <a href="1955%E2%80%9356%20Liga%20Leumit">new league season</a>, with the top division being renamed <a href="Liga%20Leumit">Liga Leumit</a>, began on 3 December 1955 and was completed on 3 June 1956, with the club finishing in 12th and bottom position, relegating to <a href="1956%E2%80%9357%20Liga%20Alef">Liga Alef</a>.
Match Results.
Legend.
 
<a href="1954%E2%80%9355%20Liga%20Alef">1954–55 Liga Alef</a>.
The league began on 6 February 1955, and by the time the <a href="1954%E2%80%9355%20in%20Israeli%20football">previous season</a> ended, only 20 rounds of matches were completed, with the final 6 rounds being played during September and October 1955.
Promotion/Relegation play-offs.
Table.
"Beitar Jerusalem relegated to <a href="1955%E2%80%9356%20Liga%20Alef">Liga Alef</a>
